Certainly, here are a few works that are similar to Alison Bechdel's representation of queer love and relationships:

1. Fun Home: A Family Tragicomic by Alison Bechdel - This graphic memoir explores Bechdel's relationship with her father, who was a closeted gay man. It deals with themes of family, sexuality, and identity. 2. Rubyfruit Jungle by Rita Mae Brown - This is a classic LGBTQ novel that follows the coming of age of Molly Bolt, a young lesbian growing up in the South. It deals with themes of identity, relationships, and societal norms. 3. Blue Is the Warmest Color by Julie Maroh - This graphic novel is a coming-of-age story that follows the relationship between two young women, Emma and Clementine. It deals with themes of love, sexuality, and self-discovery. 4. The Price of Salt by Patricia Highsmith - This novel tells the story of a love affair between a young woman named Therese and an older woman named Carol. It was groundbreaking for its time in its portrayal of a lesbian relationship. 5. Tipping the Velvet by Sarah Waters - This novel follows the life of a young woman named Nan, who falls in love with a male impersonator named Kitty. It deals with themes of gender, sexuality, and identity. All of these works share common themes with Alison Bechdel's representation of queer love and relationships and offer unique perspectives on these themes.
